[Vernon ]
Damn it!

Andrew Clark,
get up here.

Come on. Front and center.

lfhe gets up, we'll all get up.

You know, the school

at either end ofthe libray.

Go. Get back in yourseat.

l expected a little more
from a varsity letterman.

anybody, Bender.

Eat... my... shorts.

another Saturday, mister.

one more right there.

Well, l'm free the Saturday
after that. Beyond that,
l'll have to check my calendar.

Good! Because it's gonna be filled.
We'll keep going.

You want another one?

lnstead ofgoing to prison,

l'm doing societya favor.

l've gotyou for the rest

That's seven, including

Mr. Vernon here...

whether Bary Manilow knew
he raided his closet.

for two months, l got ya.
l got ya.

l'm gonna be

I love Bender's expressions and the way he says his comebacks here.. He 
knows he's digging himself deep into shit and you can tell he doesn't want 
anymore and that he's having inner turmoil, but he doesn't want to step

killed this scene. ﻿

Nelson did a really good job of pulling it off.﻿

comments.author: PowerToker420

comments.text:
+creativecomicguy Skinner certainly isn't as verbally abusive as Vernon is 
towards Bender, but it's just that the dynamic between Bender and Vernon is 
very similar to the one between Bart and Skinner in that both of the 
principals are annoyed and frustrated that the one particular kid they're 
always having to deal with is a troublemaker. Skinner vaguely looks like 
Vernon in that they both have gray hair, a similar hairstyle, and a 
disgruntled look on their face.
